name: Whizzardware
description: Experimental Whizzard Hardware deck with some basic denial strategies with Rook, Gorman Drip, and Whizzards own innate ability. Suggestions welcome. Just threw this together. I'm not much of an Anarch player (Shaper first and foremost).

name: Chaotic Wares
description: Another experimental deck. Darwin is the core breaker, with Surge to get it moving a little quicker. Another fun trick is to surge Chakana to make it immediately active. Same Ol' Things are there to recycle Surges. The major economy is Magnum Opus, with Cyberfeeders as back up and Modded to help get things into play faster. Definitely looking for any suggestions on how to improve this build/concept. Seems like an interesting direction. I like the idea of Surging Chakanas to keep the Corp from getting agendas moving. May be a good idea to slow Fast Advance.

name: Commercialising R&D v0.1
description: A new starter deck here, trying to figure out how to make commercialisation work with the identity ice advancing power, Simone Diago and Shipment from Kaguya. Seemed to play ok to our newbie eyes, but probably needs some supporting ice from other factions? Any advice welcome :-)

name: NBN - Tracing Clues
description:
An NBN glacier deck? Well all right...

The one and only objective of this deck is to give the runner as many tags as humanly possible, then drop a massive Psychographics on GRNDL Refinery or Project Beale. You shouldn't need to ice up remotes much or at all, because you should be able to basically score out of hand in both cases.

Concept deck here, completely untested, ie quite possibly crap. If anyone has any bright ideas, shout em out! :D

name: NBN Stands For 'News By NBN'
description: I've never made an NBN deck before. Here's an NBN deck built around tag + bag I guess. I have literally no idea how it plays. Probably the most interesting thing about it is the name. I hope you like it.
